dfischer.utils

Class HtmlParserForm

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.HtmlParserForm

  • public class HtmlParserForm
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all elements of a parsed HTML form. Form items like input fields are available by calling the method getFormItemTable().
    See Also:
    HtmlContentParser.getFormTable(), HtmlParserFormTable.getForms(), HtmlParserFormItemTable, HtmlParserFormItem

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAction()
      Returns the form action.
      java.lang.String getActionParam(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the value of a CGI parameter of the form action.
      HtmlParserFormItemTable getFormItemTable()
      Returns a table of all form items (input fields, hidden parameter...).
      java.lang.String getFormItemValue(java.lang.String name)
      Shortcut for getFormItemTable().getFormItem("name").getValue() .
      int getIndex()
      Returns the index of the form.
      java.lang.String getMethod()
      Returns the HTTP method of the form action (GET, POST) in UPPERCASE.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the (optional) name of the form.
      java.lang.String getTarget()
      Returns the (optional) target of the form.
      java.lang.String getTargetParam(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the value of a CGI parameter of the form target.
      boolean hasFormItems()
      Determines if the form contains form items (input fields, hidden parameter...).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Returns the index of the form. The first form on a HTML page has an index of 0.
        Returns:
        the index of the form.

      • getMethod

        public java.lang.String getMethod()
        Returns the HTTP method of the form action (GET, POST) in UPPERCASE.
        Returns:
        the HTTP method of the form action in UPPERCASE. Returns "GET" if no method was specified on the form.

      • getAction

        public java.lang.String getAction()
        Returns the form action. A url of an action may optionally contain CGI parameters.
        Returns:
        the form action. Returns an empty string if no action was specified on the form.
        See Also:
        getActionParam(java.lang.String)

      • getActionParam

        public java.lang.String getActionParam(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the value of a CGI parameter of the form action.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the CGI parameter
        Returns:
        the value of the CGI parameter. Returns null if the CGI parameter was not found on the form action.
        See Also:
        getAction()

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the (optional) name of the form.
        Returns:
        the name of the form or null if no name was specified on the form.

      • getTarget

        public java.lang.String getTarget()
        Returns the (optional) target of the form. A url of a target may optionally contain CGI parameters.
        Returns:
        the target of the form or null if no target was specified on the form.
        See Also:
        getTargetParam(java.lang.String)

      • getTargetParam

        public java.lang.String getTargetParam(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the value of a CGI parameter of the form target.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the CGI parameter
        Returns:
        the value of the CGI parameter. Returns null if the CGI parameter was not found on the form target.
        See Also:
        getTarget()

      • hasFormItems

        public boolean hasFormItems()
        Determines if the form contains form items (input fields, hidden parameter...).
        Returns:
        true if the form contains form items

      • getFormItemTable

        public HtmlParserFormItemTable getFormItemTable()
        Returns a table of all form items (input fields, hidden parameter...).
        Returns:
        a table of all form items

      • getFormItemValue

        public java.lang.String getFormItemValue(java.lang.String name)
        Shortcut for getFormItemTable().getFormItem("name").getValue() .
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the form item
        Returns:
        the value of the form item or null if no value is available.
